segment.source: 3. Profile Definitions
segment.target: 3. Profile Definitions

segment.source: 3. Profile Definitions
segment.target: 3. Profile Definitions

segment.source: Windows Performance Recorder (WPR) recording profiles are stored in an XML file that has a .wprp extension.
segment.target: Windows Performance Recorder (WPR) recording profiles are stored in an XML file that has a .wprp extension.

segment.source: Profile definitions bring together the collector and provider definitions in the .wprp file.
segment.target: Profile definitions bring together the collector and provider definitions in the .wprp file.

segment.source: In this article:
segment.target: In this article:

segment.source: Profiles
segment.target: Profiles

segment.source: Collectors Element
segment.target: Collectors Element

segment.source: Profile Definition Example
segment.target: Profile Definition Example

segment.source: Profiles
segment.target: Profiles

segment.source: You define a WPR profile by using XML tags that refer to collector and provider definition XML tags that you define in either the same .wprp file or by using inheritance in another .wprp file.
segment.target: You define a WPR profile by using XML tags that refer to collector and provider definition XML tags that you define in either the same .wprp file or by using inheritance in another .wprp file.

segment.source: Each profile definition XML tag must have the following attributes:
segment.target: Each profile definition XML tag must have the following attributes:

segment.source: Id: Unique identifier of the profile definition.
segment.target: Id: Unique identifier of the profile definition.

segment.source: Use the following profile identifier construction:
segment.target: Use the following profile identifier construction:

segment.source: Name .DetailLevel.LoggingMode.
segment.target: Name .DetailLevel.LoggingMode.

segment.source: Name: String that indicates the name of the profile.
segment.target: Name: String that indicates the name of the profile.

segment.source: DetailLevel: Attribute that specifies whether a profile definition is used for timing tracing (Light) or analysis tracing (Verbose).
segment.target: DetailLevel: Attribute that specifies whether a profile definition is used for timing tracing (Light) or analysis tracing (Verbose).

segment.source: LoggingMode: Attribute that specifies whether the profile logs events to a sequential file or to circular memory buffers.
segment.target: LoggingMode: Attribute that specifies whether the profile logs events to a sequential file or to circular memory buffers.

segment.source: All profiles must have both a file and a memory version in the same .wprp file.
segment.target: All profiles must have both a file and a memory version in the same .wprp file.

segment.source: Description: Textual description of the profile that the user sees.
segment.target: Description: Textual description of the profile that the user sees.

segment.source: WPR supports performance recording for both file and memory logging modes for each .wprp file except for on/off profiles.
segment.target: WPR supports performance recording for both file and memory logging modes for each .wprp file except for on/off profiles.

segment.source: You must log on/off profiles to a file, but you must define both a file and a memory version.
segment.target: You must log on/off profiles to a file, but you must define both a file and a memory version.

segment.source: Because a single profile definition can support only one logging mode, there can be two or four profile definitions in a .wprp file, one for each combination of logging mode and detail level.
segment.target: Because a single profile definition can support only one logging mode, there can be two or four profile definitions in a .wprp file, one for each combination of logging mode and detail level.

segment.source: All profile definitions in a single .wprp file must have the same Name attribute.
segment.target: All profile definitions in a single .wprp file must have the same Name attribute.

segment.source: Name .DetailLevel.LoggingMode
segment.target: Name .DetailLevel.LoggingMode

segment.source: The following code example shows Example1.wprp.
segment.target: The following code example shows Example1.wprp.

segment.target: This file contains two profile definitions.

segment.source: The ellipsis (…) represents the body of the profile.
segment.target: The ellipsis (…) represents the body of the profile.

segment.source: The following code example shows Example2.wprp.
segment.target: The following code example shows Example2.wprp.

segment.source: This file contains four profile definitions.
segment.target: This file contains four profile definitions.

segment.source: The ellipsis (…) represents the body of the profile.
segment.target: The ellipsis (…) represents the body of the profile.

segment.source: Collectors Element
segment.target: Collectors Element

segment.source: The Collectors element contains references to previously defined system and event collectors.
segment.target: The Collectors element contains references to previously defined system and event collectors.

segment.source: The SystemCollectorId and EventCollectorId elements identify these collectors.
segment.target: The SystemCollectorId and EventCollectorId elements identify these collectors.

segment.source: Each SystemCollectorId and EventCollectorId element contains a mandatory Value attribute that specifies the Id attribute of the collector that is to be used.
segment.target: Each SystemCollectorId and EventCollectorId element contains a mandatory Value attribute that specifies the Id attribute of the collector that is to be used.

segment.source: Each SystemCollectorId and EventCollectorId element also contains a list of either SystemProviderId or EventCollectorId elements.
segment.target: Each SystemCollectorId and EventCollectorId element also contains a list of either SystemProviderId or EventCollectorId elements.

segment.source: These elements have similar syntax.
segment.target: These elements have similar syntax.

segment.source: However, these elements refer to previously-defined system and event providers.
segment.target: However, these elements refer to previously-defined system and event providers.

segment.source: You can also define collectors and providers inside the profile definition.
segment.target: You can also define collectors and providers inside the profile definition.
